awards:
第10届中国（广州）国际纪录片节(2012)
　　“金红棉”国际纪录片评优单元 优秀纪录短片 丹尼斯·乔伊纳德

director.name: 丹尼斯·乔伊纳德 Denis Chouinard

introduction: What does it mean to be aboriginal today? The film brings us to Pessamit (formerly Betsiamites), an Innu community on the North Shore of the St. Lawrence. One-on-one with the camera, people speak their minds in surprising and revealing ways. Thirteen members of the community talk about their daily life and their identity, heartaches and hopes. Betsiamites is a portrait co loured by their words, a film that forges ties between cultures.
